job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly indicates the need to understand and deliver value in both technical and business contexts for the client.

job_tasks.phrase: help customers solve their complex data challenges
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the requirement to understand customer problems from a business perspective and map them to technical solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: help customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes the alignment of technical efforts with customer business objectives and strategic direction.

job_tasks.phrase: integrating with the wider cloud ecosystem
job_tasks.justification: This implies working with various cloud components and services, which often involves data integration aspects.
Spark programming is a key tool for data processing and can be used for building and evaluating models.
Creating reference architectures involves designing and documenting technical solutions, a core software development activity.
Developing 'how-to' guides implies creating practical, demonstrable solutions and explanations, which is part of solution development.
Building demo applications is a direct software development task focused on showcasing capabilities.
This phrase relates to the operational aspects of moving and implementing solutions, which falls under MLOps/operations.
The role title itself implies a focus on demonstrating and enabling the deployment of solutions in a pre-sales context.

soft_skills.phrase: collaboration with an Account Executive and a Senior Solutions Architect
contribute to building the Databricks technical through engagement at workshops, seminars, and meet-ups
Develop both technically and in the pre-sales aspect

classification.rationale: This role is primarily a Pre-sales Solutions Engineer focused on understanding customer business needs and demonstrating Databricks capabilities. While it involves technical aspects like Spark programming and cloud integration, it lacks specific mentions of building, fine-tuning, or deploying Generative AI models or core AI/ML model development.
